hours_text:
America On Wheels is now open all year long with new and extended hours!

## _**HOURS:**_

  * **Wednesday:** 10:00 am – 4:00 pm
  * **Thursday:** 10:00 am – 4:00 pm
  * **Friday:** 10:00 am – 4:00 pm
  * **Saturday:** 10:00 am – 4:00 pm
  * **Sunday:** 12:00 pm – 4:00 pm
  * **Monday** : Closed
  * **Tuesday** : Closed

CLOSED: Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, New Year’s Day, Memorial Day, 4th of July, and Labor Day.  
Museum can be closed to the public for Private Events.

Phone: 610-432-4200

* * *

## _**MUSEUM ADMISSION:**_

  * **Adult –** $20.00
  * **Senior**(65+)**–** $16.00
  * **Senior**  _–_ Free 1st Thursday of every month – individuals only, no groups – for limited time
  * **Youth** (ages 5-17) – $12.00
  * **Children**(ages 4 & under) – Free – with family only; no large school groups
  * **First Responders, Veterans, and Active Military (with ID) –** $12.00**  
**

### Deals & Discounts

**Free Kids Thursdays!  
** For a limited time, children twelve and under can gain free admission on Thursdays. 

**Big Deals for Big Sibs!  
** Big Brothers & Big Sisters of America are FREE with their “Littles.” (BBBS ID required)

**Special Restoration Center Tour** : Enjoy a guided tour from America On Wheels to RB Collection, a state-of-the-art Restoration Center and fully restored historic building, located just across the street. After you experience America On Wheels’ exhibit on restoration, see (in action) the process of restoring a classic car, and visit a...

collections_text:
Christmas Trains

[](https://americaonwheels.org/current-exhibit/)

[Host Your Next Event at AOW  
](https://americaonwheels.org/contact)

Our Hub Cap Café offers a nostalgic rental space featuring an authentic soda fountain counter setup from the 1950s: An ideal setting for a party or a memorable meeting/gathering. [Inquire today!](https://americaonwheels.org/contact/)

Battle of the Car Clubs

Now on display

[The Battle of The Car Clubs III](https://americaonwheels.org/current-exhibit/)

Round 3 is on! Featured in this battle are exhibits showcasing vehicles from the following clubs: North American Metropolitan Owners Club, Keystone British Car Club and the Viper Owners Association – Pennsylvania & West Virginia

Lego

FEATURED EXHIBIT

[World of Transportation](https://americaonwheels.org/current-exhibit/)

We’ve partnered with PennLUG to build a one of kind LEGO® tribute to transportation. We hope this display will delight and amaze children, spark nostalgia and joy in the hearts of adults, and inspire creativity in guests of all ages.

## Museum Location

5 North Front Street  
Allentown, PA 18102  
610.432.4200

[Directions](https://www.google.com/maps/place/America+On+Wheels+Museum/@40.606715,-75.4586877,17z/data=!3m2!4b1!5s0x89c4395d49f9de15:0x85b16ab7a569a78c!4m5!3m4!1s0x89c4395d4fd0b35b:0xbc4825655956455f!8m2!3d40.606715!4d-75.456499)

## Museum Hours

Beginning January 2025, America On Wheels now features new and expanded hours and is open the entire year.
